title: Sampler, 1825
medium:
Medium: silk and wool embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
description: Large building in center with flowers, animals, and large swan at bottom.  Text: "Hail, Night!  Thou gentle emblematic shade/ Of that tremendous period fix'd by God,/ When Drear forgetfulness shal veil the dead,/ And fame be lost beneath the green grass sod./ This ends the race of feeble man below;/ Nor pow'r, nor honour, frame nor youthful bloom,/ Can gain a respite from the dreadful blow./ Tis virtue only triumphs o'er the tomb."

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1825.
1825. Medium: silk and wool embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-87.
